intro: Psychotria erratica var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved Psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
